Zack, I know what you mean about not being able to control it, etc.  That's=
 
why I got into remote viewing - it gave me a vehicle for understanding, 
=
expression, & control without all the noise.

Thanx Mike, I do feel welcome=
 :-)


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Zack Widup 
  To: EVP-ITC@ya=
hoogroups.com 
  Sent: Sunday, December 09, 2007 7:03 AM
  Subject: Re: [EV=
P-ITC] Re: Hi! I'm new to the group;



  I've been interested for many yea=
rs in a lot of the stuff that takes 
  place outside the ham bands. Spy num=
bers stations, long delayed 
  echoes, utilitiy transmissions, oddidites, p=
irate shortwave radio, 
  over-the-horizon-radar and many other things. A l=
ot of ham operators 
  don't seem to be too interested in these things.

  =
I have thought sometimes that I was a "sensitive" but it's not something I =

  can control and it comes and goes with no apparent pattern.

  Zack (W9S=
Z)

  On Sun, 9 Dec 2007, M.A. Coletta (Mike) wrote:

  > Greetings Ken,
  =
>
  > I am also a fellow "licensed Ham Radio Operator" and have been told
 =
 > by others that I am a "Sensitive", which would explain much that has
  >=
 happened in my life.
  > On the subject of licensed operators, I'm guessin=
g there may be many
  > of us "Hams" who enjoy searching and exploring the =
world of heard &
  > unheard frequencies. It is one that is wide open at th=
e moment. That
  > is why we enjoy finding and experimenting with new techn=
iques,
  > devices, and ideas. We number many more than thirty, and there's=
 room
  > for plenty more... Welcome to the group!
  >
  > - Mike
  >
  > -=
